Creator: David Fournier  ADMB Project
Notes: Automatic differentiation makes it well suited to complex minimization problems

Creator: Lumina Decision Systems
Notes: A numerical modeling environment with a declarative and visual programming language based on influence diagrams.

Creator: SoftIntegration
Notes: C/C++ based numerical computing and graphical plotting[1]

Creator: DSP Development
Notes: Numeric computations for science and engineering featuring a spreadsheet like interface.

Creator: Dyalog Ltd.
Notes: A modern dialect of APL  enhanced with features for functional and object-oriented programming.

Creator: René Grothmann
Notes: Also a computer algebra system through interface with Maxima

Creator: Marcin Wojdyr
Notes: interactive graphics  scriptable  specialized in curve fitting and peak fitting  2D only

Creator: Weisang GmbH
Notes: Dynamic  interactive 2D/3D diagrams  programmable  VBA  high performances  multicore compatible  large data sets.

Creator: Samit Basu
Notes: Codeless interface to external C  C++  and Fortran code. Mostly compatible with MATLAB.

Creator: Aptech Systems
Notes: [empty]

Creator: Marc Schellens
Notes: Aimed as a drop-in replacement for IDL/PV-WAVE

Creator: Frederic Y. Bois & Don Maszle
Notes: General simulation and Monte Carlo sampling software

Creator: John W. Eaton
Notes: General numerical computing package with lots of extension modules. Syntax mostly compatible with MATLAB

Creator: WaveMetrics
Notes: interactive graphics  programmable  2D/3D  used for science and engineering  large data sets.

Creator: Jsoftware
Notes: online access to: J Application Library (JAL)

Creator: Jeff Bezanson  Stefan Karpinski  Viral B. Shah  and other[2] contributors
Notes: Direct calls of C functions (no wrappers needed). Designed for cloud parallel computing with LLVM JIT as a backend. Lightweight "green" threading (coroutines). Efficient support for Unicode. Shell-like capabilities for managing other processes. Lisp-like macros and other metaprogramming facilities.

Creator: National Instruments
Notes: Graphical  and textual through formula nodes  mathscript and .m file scripts[3]

Creator: Maplesoft
Notes: Mainly a computer algebra system

Creator: Parametric Technology Corporation
Notes: [empty]

Creator: Wolfram Research
Notes: Also computer algebra system

Creator: MathWorks
Notes: Numerical computation and simulation with extended 2D/3D visualization.

Creator: MIT Project MAC and Bill Schelter et al.
Notes: Mainly a computer algebra system

Creator: Civilized Software  Inc.
Notes: Numerical and Statistical computation for Scientific Applications  e.g. Chemical Kinetics. ODE Solving and Curve-Fitting. Symbolic Differentiation  Survival Analysis  Cluster Analysis  2D/3D Graphics.

Creator: OriginLab
Notes: Integrated data analysis graphing software for science and engineering. Flexible multi-layer graphing framework. 2D  3D and statistical graph types. Built-in digitizing tool. Analysis with auto recalculation and report generation. Built-in scripting and programming languages.

Creator: Karl Glazebrook
Notes: Used for astrophysics  solar physics  oceanography  biophysics  and simulation. 2D plotting via PGPLOT  PLPlot bindings; 3D via GL.

Creator: Ben Pfaff
Notes: FOSS alternative to IBM SPSS. Analysis of sampled data  frequencies  cross-tabs comparison of means (t-tests and one-way ANOVA); linear regression  logistic regression  reliability (Cronbach's Alpha  not failure or Weibull)  and re-ordering data  non-parametric tests  factor analysis  cluster analysis  principal components analysis  chi-square analysis and more

Creator: R Foundation
Notes: Primarily for statistics  but there are many interfaces to open-source numerical software

Creator: William Stein
Notes: Programmable  includes computer algebra  2D+3D plotting. Interfaces to many open-source and proprietary software. Web based interface HTTP or HTTPS

Creator: Anthony Barr and James Goodnight
Notes: [empty]

Creator: Texas Multicore Technologies
Notes: Functional programming language and tools. Delivers high performance on multicore hardware with ease of programming  and code clarity/readability. Designed to work with other languages  including C  C++  C#  Java  Fortran  Python  etc. Can be compiled to multithreaded C++ (and optionally OpenCL) code with no explicit indications from the programmer of how or what to parallelize. A platform-specific runtime manages the threads safely.

Creator: John E. Davis
Notes: Available as a standalone (slsh) and embedded interpreter (jed  slrn  ...)

Creator: Scilab Enterprises Was:Inria
Notes: Programmable  direct support of 2D+3D plotting. Interfaces to many other software packages. Interfacing to external modules written in C  Java  Python or other languages. Language syntax similar to MATLAB. Used for numerical computing in engineering and physics.

Creator: Normal H. Nie  Dale H. Bent  and C. Hadlai Hull
Notes: [empty]

Creator: Calerga
Notes: interactive graphics

Creator: Universal Technical Systems  Inc.
Notes: Numerical computation and rule-based application development

Creator: Visual Solutions
Notes: Visual Language for simulation and Model Based Design. Used in business  science and engineering. Performs complex scalar or matrix based ODE solving with parametric optimization. Has 2D and 3D plotting  3D animation  and state transition built in.

Creator: n/a
Notes: Programmable  callable 2D+3D plotting. Language syntax similar to C. Interfacing to other software packages via C calls.
